_header: This joyous time this fresh season of May
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, ‘The most woofull caytyf of fraunce’, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 66) — three 9-line stanzas (ababbcdcd) and four-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
THis ioyous tyme this fresshe cesoun of mayWhen florra shewith of
                    flowris abundaunce…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…For me so nygh is brought it may no nerreThe contrary of all
                    my wrecchid wille
BLHar682.Facsimiles:
